SEARCH
Package task5

Class QueueBroker

java.lang.Object
task5.QueueBroker
Direct Known Subclasses:
QueueBrokerImpl
public abstract class QueueBroker extends Object
A QueueBroker is a high-level abstraction that manages message-based communication by accepting connections and routing Message objects between hosts.
A MessageQueue is connected at the creation and once closed it remains closed forever.
Unlike a Broker, which works at the byte level, QueueBroker handles entire messages.

  • Constructor Details

    • QueueBroker

      public QueueBroker(task4.Broker broker)
      Create a new QueueBroker derived from the given Broker. The QueueBroker will retain the name of the parent Broker.
      Parameters:
      broker - the Broker it derives from.

  • Method Details

    • bind

      public abstract void bind(int port, QueueBroker.AcceptListener listener)
      Binds to a given port and starts listening for incoming connections. This method has to be called before any incoming connections can be accepted.
      The method will return immediately and call the QueueBroker.AcceptListener.accepted(MessageQueue) when a connection is established.
      Parameters:
      port - the port to bind and listen for incoming connections.
      listener - the listener to handle newly accepted connections.
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if the port is already in use or cannot be bound.

    • unbind

      public abstract void unbind(int port)
      Stops listening on the given port and unbinds any connections associated with it.
      Parameters:
      port - the port to unbind.

    • connect

      public abstract void connect(String host, int port, QueueBroker.ConnectListener listener)
      Connects to a remote host on the given port and establishes a message queue. The host must have a QueueBroker already bound to the given port to accept the connection.
      This method is non-blocking and will return immediately, triggering the QueueBroker.ConnectListener.connected(MessageQueue) upon success.
      Parameters:
      host - the remote host to connect to.
      port - the port to connect to.
      listener - the listener to handle the connection event.
